intro: Weihea lanceolata, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces a distinctive, fragrant flower with five petals. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in coastal areas and lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens across the Pacific region.
